It's critical Wehrum’s departure does not delay much-needed public health standards that are under development on ethylene oxide emission. U.S. EPA should release the proposed rule publicly without delay.

In Lake County, we remain frustrated that U.S. EPA under his leadership inexplicably refused to conduct ambient air monitoring to measure levels of ethylene oxide, a known carcinogen, in our communities.
